Good sons! Bodhisattvas have four obstructive dharmas that they should be aware of. What are the four?

Good sons!
Bodhisattvas have four dharmas that quickly accomplish their goals.
What are the four?
What is done is with wisdom, not with arrogance;
All wholesome roots are dedicated to enlightenment, not to the lower vehicles;
In all destinies, one does not give rise to defiled attachments, and if one does give rise to defiled attachments, one is solely dedicated to transforming sentient beings;
Day and night, during the three periods, one always cultivates the three parts, eliminating past evil karma and not creating it in the future.
These are the four.
And he spoke a verse, saying:

Not giving rise to arrogance or conceit, with an upright mind, cultivating wholesome conduct.

Good man!
